intro: Thesium chimanimaniense, commonly known as the Chimanimani thesium, is a flowering plant native to the Chimanimani Mountains in eastern Zimbabwe. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants known for their ornamental value. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
